meanings.definition: To fill up or make full.
meanings.sent1: I need to upfill the water bottle before we go on our hike.
meanings.sent2: Please upfill the gas tank before we start our road trip.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to upfill the cake with extra frosting to make it look perfect.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to upfill the room with joy and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The sun slowly upfilled the sky with its warm light, signaling the start of a new day.

meanings.definition: To fill completely or to the top.
meanings.sent1: He carefully upfilled the glass with milk, making sure not to spill any.
meanings.sent2: The workers had to upfill the hole in the road with gravel to make it safe for driving.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to upfill the hat with endless scarves, but they kept getting tangled.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him seemed to upfill her heart to the brim, overflowing with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The music slowly upfilled the concert hall, enveloping the audience in its beautiful melodies.
